com.xhive.core.interfaces
Interface XhiveUserListIf

All Superinterfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<XhiveUserIf>
public interface XhiveUserListIf
extends java.lang.Iterable<XhiveUserIf>

Collects XhiveUserIf objects in a list.

Every XhiveDatabaseIf object has an XhiveUserListIf object representing all users that have access to the database. Every XhiveUserIf of a XhiveUserListIf has a user name that is unique within the XhiveUserListIf object. XhiveUserIf objects are managed by the administrator.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

Method Detail

getUser

XhiveUserIf getUser(java.lang.String username)
Get a user with the specified user name.

As every user in the XhiveUserListIf user list has a unique user name, only one user is returned.

Parameters:
username - the name of the user to be retrieved.
Returns:
An XhiveUserListIf object.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

iterator

java.util.Iterator<XhiveUserIf> iterator()
Get an iterator for iterating through the users in this list.

Objects returned by this iterator should be casted to the XhiveUserIf interface.

Specified by:
iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<XhiveUserIf>
Returns:
The user iterator.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

size

int size()
Get the number of users within this user list.

Returns:
The number of users.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

hasUser

boolean hasUser(java.lang.String username)
Check whether an XhiveUserListIf user list contains a user with the specified user name.

Parameters:
username - the user name.
Returns:
true if the user exists within this XhiveUserListIf user list.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

removeUser

void removeUser(XhiveUserIf user)
Remove a user object from the database.

Only the administrator or super user is allowed to remove a user from the userlist. The administrator object itself cannot be removed.

Parameters:
user - the user to be removed.
Throws:
ADMINISTRATOR_DELETION_ERROR - when attempting to delete the administrator.
ACCESS_DENIED - when a user other than the administrator or super user tries to remove a user.
DELETION_ERROR - general error.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0

addUser

XhiveUserIf addUser(java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String password)
Creates a new transient XhiveUserIf user, and adds it to the list. Only the administrator or super user can add a user to the XhiveUserListIf user list.

Parameters:
username - the user name.
password - the password.
Returns:
the new transient XhiveUserIf user object.
Throws:
PASSWORD_ERROR - when the password is not a valid password.
USER_ALREADY_EXISTS - when a user with the same username already belongs to the XhiveUserListIf
ACCESS_DENIED - when a user other than the administrator or super user tries to add the user.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.0
